<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 13"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scrutinizing Gaze](/Feats.aspx?ID=3291) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Dwarf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=54" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 201</row>

**Access**
You are from Dongun Hold or Alkenstar.

</column>

---

Your family's traditions of defending against Geb's [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) have granted you a sixth sense for detecting spirits, haunts, and other restless dead, no matter their form or the strength of their presence. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to [Sense Motive](/Actions.aspx?ID=85) when trying to determine if a creature is possessed or under the influence of an effect that would make them [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6), a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks made to see through disguises worn by undead, and a +2 circumstance bonus when using the Seek action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) [haunts](/Traits.aspx?ID=88) or undead within 30 feet of you.

 If you aren't using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action or searching, the GM automatically rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) check for you to notice haunts or undead within 30 feet anyway. This check doesn't gain the usual +2 circumstance bonus, and instead takes a –2 circumstance penalty.
